honeywell.printer

Class DocumentEZ

  • java.lang.Object
    • honeywell.printer.Document
      • honeywell.printer.DocumentEZ

  • public class DocumentEZ
extends Document
    This class handles the interface between the printer and the user application that wishes to use an Datamax-O'Neil printer. These functions can be used to 'build' a document using abstract methods instead of the raw 'EZ Print' mode commands. A simple example is:

        // Print Hello World
    DocumentEZ docEZ;
    docEZ = new DocumentEZ("$");
    docEZ.writeText("Hello World",1,1);
    This document can then be sent to a PrinterONeil object through the print method to print out.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  DocumentEZ.QStop
      QStop options for use when feeding the paper

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialPaperBackup

        public int getInitialPaperBackup()
        This is the amount of dotlines, each 1/8mm, the paper will be 'backed-up' before printing is started. The default value is 0 dotlines.
        Returns:
        The number of dotlines, each 1/8mm, to initially back-up.

      • setInitialPaperBackup

        public void setInitialPaperBackup(int dotLines)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This is the amount of dotlines, each 1/8mm, the paper will be 'backed-up' before printing is started. The default value is 0 dotlines.
        Parameters:
        dotLines - The number of dotlines, each 1/8mm, to initially back-up. Valid values are from 0 to 8192 dotlines.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • getPageLength

        public int getPageLength()
        The page length is the maximum number of rows, in dot lines, that can be printed. This will put an upper bound on the document size if constraints require it. The default value is 0 meaning no maximum.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of dotlines to print from the beginning of the document.

      • setPageLength

        public void setPageLength(int dotLines)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The page length is the maximum number of rows, in dot lines, that can be printed. This will put an upper bound on the document size if constraints require it. The default value is 0 meaning no maximum.
        Parameters:
        dotLines - Maximum number of dotlines to print from the beginning of the document. Valid values are from 0 to 8192 dotlines.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • getPrintQuantity

        public int getPrintQuantity()
        This is the number of copies of the document to print. The default number is 1.
        Returns:
        The number of copies of the document to print.

      • getPrintQuantityOptimized

        public boolean getPrintQuantityOptimized()
        This will cause multiple print jobs to be 'optimized' by only performing the initial paper backup on the first item if set to true. Setting it to false will cause each job to be printed as if it were an individual request. The default value for this property is false.
        Returns:
        If the print optimization mode is enabled.

      • setPrintQuantity

        public void setPrintQuantity(int quantity)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This sets the number of copies of the document to print. The default value for quantity is 1.
        Parameters:
        quantity - The number of copies of the document to print. Valid values are from 1 to 255.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter value is not in the valid range this exception is thrown.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setPrintQuantityOptimized

        public void setPrintQuantityOptimized(boolean optimize)
        This sets if the process should be optimized by removing the initial paper backup setting for the 2nd and greater copies. Setting optimize to true will cause multiple print jobs to be 'optimized' by only performing the initial paper backup on the first item if set to true. Setting it to false will cause each job to be printed as if it were an individual request. The default value for optimize is false.
        Parameters:
        optimize - If the print optimizations mode is enabled.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • getQMarkDotLines

        public int getQMarkDotLines()
        This gets the number of dotlines after the queue mark is found to stop feeding paper. This value is only used if QMarkStop is not the default value. Each dotline is 1/8mm and the default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The number of dotlines after the queue mark is found to stop.

      • getQMarkStop

        public DocumentEZ.QStop getQMarkStop()
        This gets the queue mark behavior for the printer. The default setting is QStop.Default causing the printer to act according to the value programmed into its internal flash memory. The other values available are:
        • QStop.Default - The printer will act according to the value programmed into its internal flash memory.
        • QStop.Front - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the queue mark is found on the front of the media. This mode applies to the LP3, MF2T, MF3, 2t and 4t.
        • QStop.Back - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the queue marks is found on the back of the media. This mode applies to the LP3.
        • QStop.Gap - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the inter-label gap is found between labels. This mode applies to the LP3.
        • QStop.None - The printer will ignore all queue stop settings in its internal flash memory and just print normally.
        Not all values are applicable to all printer models. Which ones apply depend on which sensors are installed on the particular printer.
        Returns:
        The queue mark behavior for the printer.

      • setQMarkStop

        public void setQMarkStop(DocumentEZ.QStop mode)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This sets the queue mark behavior for the printer. The default setting is QStop.Default causing the printer to act according to the value programmed into its internal flash memory. The other values available are:
        • QStop.Default - The printer will act according to the value programmed into its internal flash memory.
        • QStop.Front - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the queue mark is found on the front of the media. This mode applies to the LP3, MF2T, MF3, 2t and 4t.
        • QStop.Back - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the queue marks is found on the back of the media. This mode applies to the LP3.
        • QStop.Gap - The printer will stop printing the set number of dotlines after the inter-label gap is found between labels. This mode applies to the LP3.
        • QStop.None - The printer will ignore all queue stop settings in its internal flash memory and just print normally.
        Not all values are applicable to all printer models. Which ones apply depend on which sensors are installed on the particular printer.
        Parameters:
        mode - The queue mark behavior for the printer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • writeBarCodeGS1DataBar

        public void writeBarCodeGS1DataBar(java.lang.String GS1Font,
                                   java.lang.String primaryData,
                                   java.lang.String compositeData,
                                   int pixelMultiplier,
                                   int sepRowHt,
                                   int xcut,
                                   int ycut,
                                   int segPerRow,
                                   int row,
                                   int col)
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a GS1 barcode using the default printing parameter values.
        Note: If the composite data is exists(not null or not empty string), the primary data and 2D composite data is separated with '\*' in the print job. (eg.ABCDEFGHIJKL\*helloWorld!123)
        Parameters:
        GS1Font - Name of the GS1 Barcode to print. Valid Values:

        GS1 Barcode Names

        ValueDescription
        GS1TRGS1 Truncated Barcode
        GS1STGS1 Stacked Barcode
        GS1SOGS1 Stacked Omni Barcode
        GS1LMGS1 Limited Barcode
        GS1EXGS1 Expanded Barcode
        GSONEGS1 Barcode
        primaryData - Primary data to print as barcode.

        Valid input data:

        GS1 Barcode TypeValid InputsNotes
        GS1 Truncated0-913-digit value with maximum of 106 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 79 checksum
        GS1 Stacked/Stacked Omnidirectional0-913-digit value with maximum of 95 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 79 checksum
        GS1 Limited0-913-digit value with maximum of 106 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 89 checksum
        GS1 Expanded0-9A-Za-z!"%&'(*+,-./:;<=>?Maximum of 70 numeric characters in the primary data (fewer if mixed with alphabetic/punctuation marks). Maximum of 119 numeric data with primary and 2D composite data combined (fewer if mixed with alphabetic/punctuation marks). Error detection is mod 211 checksum
        compositeData - composite data to print as barcode. Separate primary data and 2D composite data with '\*'(eg.ABCDEFGHIJKL*helloWorld!123)

        Valid input data:

        Valid InputsNotes
        All alphanumericsComposite Data + Primary Data must not exceed 120 characters
        pixelMultiplier - Pixel multiplier value. Changes the height and width of barcode in 5 dots per inch.
        sepRowHt - Separator Row Height. Must be between 1x Pixel multiplier and 2x pixel multiplier. Default value is pixelMultiplier value.
        xcut - X Pixel Undercut value. Must be between 0 and Pixel Multiplier-1. Default is 0.
        ycut - Y Pixel undercut value. Must be between 0 and Pixel multiplier-1. Default is 0.
        segPerRow - Segments per row. Only used for GS1 Expanded Barcode. Valid values are even numbers between 2 and 22. Default value is 22. If odd number is enter, it will be set to the default value. If not use, set value to 0.
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.

      • writeBarCodeGS1DataBar

        public void writeBarCodeGS1DataBar(java.lang.String GS1Font,
                                   java.lang.String primaryData,
                                   java.lang.String compositeData,
                                   int pixelMultiplier,
                                   int sepRowHt,
                                   int xcut,
                                   int ycut,
                                   int segPerRow,
                                   int row,
                                   int col,
                                   ParametersEZ parameters)
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a GS1 barcode using the provided printing parameter values.
        Note: If the composite data is exists(not null or not empty string), the primary data and 2D composite data is separated with '\*' in the print job. (eg.ABCDEFGHIJKL\*helloWorld!123)
        Parameters:
        GS1Font - Name of the GS1 Barcode to print. Valid Values:

        GS1 Barcode Names

        ValueDescription
        GS1TRGS1 Truncated Barcode
        GS1STGS1 Stacked Barcode
        GS1SOGS1 Stacked Omni Barcode
        GS1LMGS1 Limited Barcode
        GS1EXGS1 Expanded Barcode
        GSONEGS1 Barcode
        primaryData - Primary data to print as barcode.

        Valid input data:

        GS1 Barcode TypeValid InputsNotes
        GS1 Truncated0-913-digit value with maximum of 106 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 79 checksum
        GS1 Stacked/Stacked Omnidirectional0-913-digit value with maximum of 95 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 79 checksum
        GS1 Limited0-913-digit value with maximum of 106 characters in 2D composite data. Error detection is mod 89 checksum
        GS1 Expanded0-9A-Za-z!"%&'(*+,-./:;<=>?Maximum of 70 numeric characters in the primary data (fewer if mixed with alphabetic/punctuation marks). Maximum of 119 numeric data with primary and 2D composite data combined (fewer if mixed with alphabetic/punctuation marks). Error detection is mod 211 checksum
        compositeData - composite data to print as barcode. Separate primary data and 2D composite data with '\*'(eg.ABCDEFGHIJKL*helloWorld!123)

        Valid input data:

        Valid InputsNotes
        All alphanumericsComposite Data + Primary Data must not exceed 120 characters
        pixelMultiplier - Pixel multiplier value. Changes the height and width of barcode in 5 dots per inch.
        sepRowHt - Separator Row Height. Must be between 1x Pixel multiplier and 2x pixel multiplier. Default value is pixelMultiplier value.
        xcut - X Pixel Undercut value. Must be between 0 and Pixel Multiplier-1. Default is 0.
        ycut - Y Pixel undercut value. Must be between 0 and Pixel multiplier-1. Default is 0.
        segPerRow - Segments per row. Only used for GS1 Expanded Barcode. Valid values are even numbers between 2 and 22. Default value is 22. If odd number is enter, it will be set to the default value. If not use, set value to 0.
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        parameters - This ParametersEZ object specifies any printing parameter values you wish to alter for the printing of this item.

      • writeBarCodeQRCode

        public void writeBarCodeQRCode(java.lang.String textString,
                               int errorCorrectionLevel,
                               int mask,
                               int mode,
                               int row,
                               int col)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a QR barcode using the default printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - Text to print as barcode. For Manual Mode, Format as follow: [CHARACTER_MODE][TEXT]. To Switch between character mode, terminate the data string using a comma ',' follow by the next mode. (ex. N0123456789,B0004(&#),QR//BARCODE)

        Character modes

        ValueDescription
        NNumeric (0-9)
        AAlphanumeric(0-9A-Z[space]$%*+-./:)
        BBinary. The next 4 char indicate number of data bytes encoded. The next 4 char will then be encoded into barcode but not interpreted in any way.
        KKanji
        errorCorrectionLevel - Error Correction Level. Possible input values:
        ValueDescription
        1Level L (7%)
        2Level M (15%)
        3Level Q (25%) (default)
        4Level H (30%)
        mask - Mask number:
        ValueDescription
        0mask 0
        1mask 1
        2mask 2
        3mask 3
        4mask 4
        5mask 5
        6mask 6
        7mask 7
        8no mask
        9auto mask
        mode - Auto or Manual formatting of barcode
        ValueDescription
        0Auto Formatting
        1Manual Formatting
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • writeBarCodeQRCode

        public void writeBarCodeQRCode(java.lang.String textString,
                               int errorCorrectionLevel,
                               int mask,
                               int mode,
                               int row,
                               int col,
                               ParametersEZ parameters)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a QR barcode using the provided printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - Text to print as barcode. For Manual Mode, Format as follow: [CHARACTER_MODE][TEXT]. To Switch between character mode, terminate the data string using a comma ',' follow by the next mode. (ex. N0123456789,B0004(&#),QR//BARCODE)

        Character modes

        ValueDescription
        NNumeric (0-9)
        AAlphanumeric(0-9A-Z[space]$%*+-./:)
        BBinary. The next 4 char indicate number of data bytes encoded. The next 4 char will then be encoded into barcode but not interpreted in any way.
        KKanji
        errorCorrectionLevel - Error Correction Level. Possible input values:
        ValueDescription
        1Level L (7%)
        2Level M (15%)
        3Level Q (25%) (default)
        4Level H (30%)
        mask - Mask number:
        ValueDescription
        0mask 0
        1mask 1
        2mask 2
        3mask 3
        4mask 4
        5mask 5
        6mask 6
        7mask 7
        8no mask
        9auto mask
        mode - Auto or Manual formatting of barcode
        ValueDescription
        0Auto Formatting
        1Manual Formatting
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        parameters - This ParametersEZ object specifies any printing parameter values you wish to alter for the printing of this item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • writeBarCodeAztec

        public void writeBarCodeAztec(java.lang.String text,
                              int errorCorrectionLevel,
                              int row,
                              int col)
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a Aztec barcode using the default printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        text - text to print as barcode
        errorCorrectionLevel - Error Correction Level. Possible input values:
        ValueDescription
        0Default (23%)
        1-99minimum error correction as a percentage of the symbol
        101-04for a compact symbol (1xx specifies a compact symbol where xx specifies the number of layers; 01 - 04 are valid
        201-232for a full range symbol (2xx specifies a fully range symbol where xx specifies the number of layers; 01 - 32 are valid
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.

        201-232for a full range symbol (2xx specifies a fully range symbol where xx specifies the number of layers; 01 - 32 are valid

      • writeBarCodePDF417

        public void writeBarCodePDF417(java.lang.String textString,
                               int row,
                               int col,
                               int dataColumns,
                               int redundancyLevel)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a PDF417 2D barcode using the default printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - Text to print as PDF417 2D barcode.
        row - Row position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        dataColumns - Use this parameter to override the default of 2 columns for the PDF-417 bar code to specify the actual number of data columns being printed across any given line of the bar code.
        redundancyLevel - This will set the number of redundant codewords used to protect against data loss/corruption. The typical value is 1 which would result in 4 codewords. Other values are 2 giving you 8 codewords, 3 giving you 16 codewords up to 8 giving you 512 codewords.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • writeBarCodePDF417

        public void writeBarCodePDF417(java.lang.String textString,
                               int row,
                               int col,
                               int dataColumns,
                               int redundancyLevel,
                               ParametersEZ parameters)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This function will print the provided text to the document as a PDF417 2D barcode using the provided printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - Text to print as PDF417 2D barcode.

        col - Column position, starting from zero, to start printing at.
        dataColumns - Use this parameter to override the default of 2 columns for the PDF-417 bar code to specify the actual number of data columns being printed across any given line of the bar code.
        redundancyLevel - This will set the number of redundant codewords used to protect against data loss/corruption. The typical value is 1 which would result in 4 codewords. Other values are 2 giving you 8 codewords, 3 giving you 16 codewords up to 8 giving you 512 codewords.
        parameters - This ParametersEZ object specifies any printing parameter values you wish to alter for the printing of this item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • getDocumentData

        public byte[] getDocumentData()
        This method will return the rendered document in the printer's language for sending directly to the printer.
        Specified by:
        getDocumentData in class Document
        Returns:
        Rendered document in the printer's language.
        Since:
        1.1.0
